content: If I POST a new Patient resource and I add a undefined element - for example 'Patient.eye_color' - should the server give an error or simply ignore it? I thought it should fail but I'm not sure.
Since it is not FHIR compliant, I would expect the server to give an error.
@James Agnew in HAPI this check is done by the validator, right?

Servers are allowed to ignore unexpected elements if they're trying to be future-version friendly (though that's really only 'safe' with normative resources, because with non-normative, the new element could be a modifier.)
HAPI should yell though, given that it's a reference implementation

This depends on which ParserErrorHandler you have configured.. The default is the Lenient one that will log a warning, but there is also a Strict one that will flat out reject.

This applies to a handful of other possible parse errors too - E.g. using "valueBoolean": "true" instead of "valueBoolean": true and null values
@James Agnew Can the publicly hosted one change to 'strict'?
I remember somewhere says that server should ignore the element it does not recognize just as not received. Maybe I got confused with V2?
we say it's receiver discretion. it can choose to, but we do not use "should" anywhere
